summary: Brilliant mathematician Anand Kumar helps 30 smart but underprivileged students prepare for entrance exams for the Indian Institutes of Technology.

reviews.content: Inspiring true story and a good performance from its lead.
Hrithik Roshan tries hard to get into the character, but succeeds only as much as the film. Overall, the writing is more disappointing than Hrithik.
Lot of flaws....not inspiring at all as the biopic should be....worthless

It's a MUST WATCH. Inspiring and emotional. Watch it to get motivated see there difficulties to get into education system and how there Teacher helps them out without any greedy wish. Hrithik Roshan marvelous.

Though the story is based on real-life, it is too much polished and that's why it became unrealistic. I felt like reading a children's literature; where a hero is always 100% accurate and the anti-hero is always 100% inaccurate.

It's one of the best biopics. Lot to learn about principles to be applied in life. Amazing for students who want to pursue a carrier. Will encourage them for good. These kind of movies are Not very common these days. Must Watch..!🤗

"Super 30" has an interesting storyline and rock-solid message. For the most part, I really liked this movie. I think it has a positive nature that is hard to resist. What drives this movie is Hrithik Roshan's convincing and likable lead performance. His character is easy to empathize with and understand. I did feel the story does a dip in quality in the second half and does drag a little bit. I also thought the story jumped from plot point to plot point somewhat quickly at times and it could feel a bit jarring. Despite some minor storytelling flaws,  this is still a very good movie with an important statement about being born with or without certain levels of privilege that are relevant for everyone to hear.
Good story but the loose script is not suitable for the wellness of the movie
I liked the way they presented the life of Anand Kumar. It gives inspiration to many other people.
Too sensationalised added with pathetic performance

Between Hrithik in brown face (why not give a darker-skinned actor a chance?), a #metoo predator director who got to keep his film credit, and a true story that's been proved fraudulent in court, can't say I had high expectations of this one. But was surprised that it did reasonably well at the box office, so gave it a shot. Hrithik did well. It was hard to imagine it's the same actor as War. The supporting cast was good too. The storyline in ridiculous though and the editing choppy as hell. I wanted to root for the kids, but the whole thing weirdly felt like an exercise in exploiting them. Some good issues raised, but this topic deserved a movie with better writing and actual nuance. Hard to believe it was the same director as the gem, Queen. Anyway, save your sanity and read some well-researched articles on the topic. This movie isn't going to provide any real insight.

One of the best performance of Hrithik Roshan's career.

Very nice enjoyed, laughed, cried what an emotional ride nice work well done Hrithik Roshan.
One of the best movie... Must Watch Movie... Great Story of a Real Hero... Aanand Ji Humanity will alwas be proud of you...
Super 30 is just amazing! The movie will give goosebumps at times.a true original story

Simply outstanding!!!!!!! Hrithik's performance is fabulous!!!
This movie is awesome all students should watch

Playing a Real Life character on big screen is a daunting task for any actor, despite his/her charismatic reputation. Imitating that person's Body Language, Linguistic Expressions, Verbal Annotations is something that's easier said than done. Many of them failed to being realistic and justifying to the real life person! But I'm happy to say that's not the case with Hrithik Here!

He has done tremendously well with his character. With his emotions, expressions and language ; Everything felt relatable and believable.

Camera Work, Direction, Sound Score, Screenplay all the things have justified the premise of the film. But In some aspects some things have fallen apart even for a little bit of time.

The main problem lies with the Character Development of the other characters except the main Lead Anand Kumar. His family, His rival or His group of students. Everyone's part in the story felt underwhelming or should I say restricted for the sake of Hrithik's Character being the center of attention.

All the focus have been diverted to the Main Lead and his life struggles, Achivements, Vulnerabilities etc. But we never got the same treatment or could connect well to the other cast members at all! Though they gave their pretty best respectively.

Just for example the group of 30 students who should have been the sole focus of the film have been left out in characterization department. None of the students among them shined or would be remembered for their own backstories and weaknesses. The makers summed up the whole group as one and wrote the Screenplay accordingly.

Kind of Unfortunate If yoh take my opinion as it had so much promising aspects in it.

Another issue here is its longer duration, I don't usually have complaints about the runtimes but If they are not being utilized properly then the unnecessary scenes must be cut short so that the story itself feels more compact and tighter on the scale.

In the end, As a Biopic it's a really good one, For the Hrithik Fans it would be a Treat for sure. And For the Casual Movie Goers ; Might not be the best but would not bore you either I assure.

I watched this film on Hotstar. I know. This film feels just not right from its cover. But as they, one should never judge a book by its cover. Although Hrithik may seem a misfit for this role but like always, he outplayed himself! This is by far his best performance. He was effortless, enigmatic and highly inspirational. This film captures the dark side of Indian vintage class divisions, and how quality education is available only to a handful of privileged people.
What a brilliant story portrayed so well

The film carries good intentions, inspiring plot and entertainment- and for that, I recommend you watch it. But the inconsistently too light writing and ridiculous characterization of people other than those in Anand Kumar's life, especially his students, is a letdown. But still, its fun at its running time mostly, and so, it is watchable.

My Rating 10/10  !!!NO SPOILERS!!!

The movie has many negatives, but its positives in highlighting the feats of one idealist outweigh them all. Well-acted and original.

I decided to see this movie as soon as I read the reviews.  Professional reviewers are jaded and the everyman/woman reviews carry the most weight with me.  This movie proved to be one of the most amazing theatrical productions I've had the pleasure of experiencing.  Based somewhat on real people and events, it is nonetheless an entertaining, moving depiction of one man's determination to fight injustice.  Anand's father is the real hero of this movie, his example is one to be admired.

Great inspiring movie about Anand Kumar. The world needs more inspiring dedicated people like Anand Kumar. Having said that I BEG Bollywood directors and story writer not to make biographical movies. This would have been a Oscar winning movie had the director stuck to facts.

dear rotten tomatoes’ “professional” movie critics,   umm, you guys must actually be rotten. YOU ARE BOGUS!!! 36%!! REALLY? don’t you think that’s a huge difference from the audience’s rating of 91%? you think so many people are wrong? surely, you cannot be serious. i bet you guys would have rated this movie higher if the main lead was salman khan or shahrukh khan. really, you guys are just CHAMCHAS (butt-lickers). the director and producer of this movie went through so much to obtain real facts and data about the kids in the story so they could inspire everyone, especially children, to show how education makes a huge difference in your life. in reality, you critics, are just sitting in your air conditioned rooms, sipping expensive coffees, while the poor kids portrayed in the film and many others like them around the world don’t even have a day’s worth of food, yet they are so determined. shame on you guys. anyways, hats off to hrithik roshan and the rest of the cast for doing such a great job. just because he does not know how to work around movie politics, you guys target him and give him bad reviews. we know your reality.
